areaDescription: The Northern Corrupted Woods exist as the epicenter of Malarok's dark influence, where ancient trees have been twisted into grotesque forms by the sorcerer's Voidstone magic. Black-needled pines writhe skyward like grasping fingers, their trunks weeping dark sap that pulses with corrupt energy. The air hums with Malarok's power, making metal grow cold and thoughts sluggish. At the heart of this blighted grove lie the crumbling ruins where the sorcerer conducts his dark rituals, protected by magical wards and corrupted guardians.

locations.name: Corrupted Entry Cave
locations.description: The mouth of this limestone cavern weeps black sap corrupted by Malarok's Voidstone magic, pooling in unnatural patterns on the stone floor. Pale, sickly fungi cast an eerie glow throughout the twisted passages. The air tastes of dark magic and decay, and Malarok's corrupting influence can be felt even here at the forest's edge.

npcs.name: Corrupted Cave Fisher
npcs.description: Once a normal cave fisher, this creature has been twisted by Malarok's Voidstone magic into something far more sinister. Its chitinous shell now bears veins of pulsing dark energy, and its fishing line drips with the sorcerer's corruption that can weaken both flesh and spirit.
npcs.attitude: Hostile and territorial, it will attack anything that enters its domain, driven by Malarok's corrupting influence.

lootTable: Cave fisher chitin plates warped by dark magic
Ancient warning tablets carved in Common and Sylvan
plotHooks: Ancient warning tablets describe the spread of corruption from Malarok's rituals in the ruins
The corrupted cave fisher was twisted by the sorcerer's Voidstone magic
Strange magical emanations lead toward Malarok's ritual site deeper in the grove
Claw marks show desperate attempts by wildlife to escape Malarok's spreading influence
locations.dmInstructions: This serves as the entry point to Malarok's corrupted domain. The cave fisher represents the first serious supernatural threat twisted by the sorcerer's magic. Use the corruption effects to foreshadow Malarok's power and the Voidstone's influence.

traps.name: Corrupted Spore Cloud
traps.description: Disturbing the tainted fungi releases a cloud of corrupting spores that sap strength and vitality.
traps.effect: DC 14 Constitution save or take 1d4 necrotic damage and have maximum hit points reduced by the damage taken

dcChecks: Arcana DC 15: Understand the nature of the corruption affecting the cave and its creatures
Nature DC 13: Recognize that the cave ecosystem has been completely perverted by supernatural forces
Perception DC 12: Notice the whispers coming from deeper in the cave system
locations.accessibility: Cave entrance from the southern approaches, connecting to the corrupted interior

features.name: Weeping Stone Walls
features.description: The limestone walls constantly weep black, tar-like corruption that pools on the cave floor in unnatural geometric patterns.

features.name: Phosphorescent Fungi
features.description: Sickly pale mushrooms provide an eerie, pulsing light throughout the cave, their glow tainted with corruption.

features.name: Whisper Echoes
features.description: Faint whispers in unknown languages echo from deeper in the cave system, growing stronger near areas of concentrated corruption.

locations.name: Blighted Thornbriar Grove
locations.description: What was once a sacred druidic grove now stands as a monument to corruption, where ancient oak trees bleed crimson sap and their branches writhe with malevolent life. Thorny briars have grown to massive proportions, forming twisted barriers that pulse with dark energy, while the ground beneath is carpeted with blackened leaves that crumble to ash at the slightest touch.

npcs.name: Thorn-Touched Dryad Sylara
npcs.description: Once the guardian spirit of this sacred grove, Sylara has been corrupted by the spreading taint. Her bark-like skin now bears veins of pulsing darkness, and her once-beautiful features have become gaunt and terrible. She still possesses fragments of her former memories and struggles against the corruption consuming her.
npcs.attitude: Conflicted and tormented, sometimes lucid and desperate for help, other times consumed by corrupted rage. May fight or aid the party depending on their approach.

lootTable: Heartwood staff infused with corruption resistance
Vial of dryad tears with purification properties
Ancient druidic tome describing the corruption's origin
Seed of the World Tree (uncorrupted, extremely rare)
plotHooks: Sylara knows the source of the corruption and may reveal it if the party can reach her uncorrupted essence
The grove was the first place the corruption took hold, making it crucial to understanding the threat
Ancient druidic wards still function partially, suggesting a way to cleanse or contain the corruption
Sylara's corruption is spreading to other nature spirits throughout the region
locations.dmInstructions: Sylara is the key NPC for this area. Her internal struggle between corruption and her true nature should drive the encounter. If the party can help her resist the corruption (through roleplay, magic, or completing her requests), she becomes a valuable ally. If they attack or fail to connect with her, she becomes a tragic boss fight.

traps.name: Animated Thorn Barriers
traps.description: Massive briars that lash out at intruders, animated by the corruption flowing through the grove.
traps.effect: 2d6 piercing damage plus DC 13 Constitution save or be poisoned for 1 hour

dcChecks: Religion DC 14: Recognize the signs of desecrated sacred ground and understand purification rituals
Nature DC 15: Understand how the corruption has perverted the natural druidic magic of the grove
Persuasion DC 16: Reach Sylara's uncorrupted essence and convince her to fight against the taint
locations.accessibility: Central grove connected to multiple areas, but passage hindered by aggressive plant growth

features.name: Bleeding Sacred Oaks
features.description: Ancient oak trees that weep crimson sap, their branches moving with unnatural life as corruption flows through their heartwood.

features.name: Corrupted Fairy Rings
features.description: Once-magical mushroom circles now pulse with dark energy, creating areas of concentrated corruption that twist reality.

features.name: Twisted Thorn Maze
features.description: Massive briars form a maze-like barrier throughout the grove, their thorns dripping with corrupting toxins.

features.name: Desecrated Stone Circle
features.description: An ancient druidic stone circle whose runes now glow with malevolent energy, the corruption's influence strongest here.

encounters.summary:
{
  "narration": "In the shadowed depths of the Blighted Thornbriar Grove, Eirik Hearthwise and Scout Kira faced a hostile ambush by two Twig Blights and a corrupted Awakened Shrub. The twisted wooden fiends struck swiftly, clawing and raking with thorned limbs that drew blood and left trails of dark, necrotic sap. Despite the relentless assault, Eirik and Kira held firm; Eirik's mace shattered bark and rended corrupted wood while Kira's arrows found their marks after initial misses. The battle was fierce but methodical, with the first twig blight felled by Kira's precise shot and the second battered down by Eirik's strikes. Ultimately, the Awakened Shrub was the last to fall, collapsing into rotting debris as the corruption animating it faded away. Both combatants endured minor wounds but remained resolute, standing victorious amid the twisted, oppressive grove as its dark energy waned. The encounter awarded 250 experience points total--divided evenly between Eirik and Kira, granting each 125 XP--marking a hard-won triumph against the corrupted guardians of the blighted woods.",

    "Round 3: Twig Blight_2 clawed Eirik causing 2 damage; Twig Blight clawed Kira causing 2 damage; Awakened Shrub's attack was ineffective; Kira's arrow struck and killed Twig Blight_2; Eirik attacked Twig Blight, damaging it.",
    "Round 4: Twig Blight attacked but was blocked by Eirik's shield; Awakened Shrub's attack missed; Kira's arrow hit and destroyed the Twig Blight; Eirik assaulted Awakened Shrub, damaging it.",
    "Round 5: Awakened Shrub's attack was deflected; Kira's arrow hit and killed the Awakened Shrub, ending the combat."
  ]
}

locations.name: Hollow of the Withered Hart
locations.description: A natural amphitheater formed by towering stone walls creates a sacred space where The Withered Hart makes its final stand against the corruption. Ancient petroglyphs covering the stone surfaces tell the story of the forest's guardians, while pools of pure spring water reflect starlight even in the depths of corruption. Here, the last vestige of the forest's original spirit fights a losing battle against the encroaching darkness.

npcs.name: The Withered Hart
npcs.description: A magnificent white stag whose antlers once bore leaves of every season, now stands as the forest's last guardian against corruption. Though withered and bearing wounds that weep silver light, the Hart retains fragments of ancient wisdom and the power to cleanse corruption. Its eyes hold the sadness of watching an entire forest fall to darkness.
npcs.attitude: Noble but weary, initially suspicious of mortals but grateful for genuine aid. Will test the party's intentions before offering assistance or knowledge.

lootTable: Vial of Hart's tears (powerful healing potion)
Map to the corruption's source carved in ancient stone (reveals hidden path to NC05)
Blessing of the Forest Guardian (permanent boon)
plotHooks: The Withered Hart knows the exact source of the corruption and has revealed the Guardian's Path - a hidden route that leads directly to the Corrupted Nexus
The Hart's power is the only thing preventing the corruption from spreading beyond the northern woods
Ancient forest magic could be restored if the corruption's source is destroyed
The Hart will sacrifice itself to create a powerful ward if no other solution can be found
locations.dmInstructions: The Withered Hart is the emotional and narrative climax of the module. This noble creature represents hope in the face of overwhelming corruption. The party's interaction with the Hart should feel significant and mythic. If treated with respect and aided in its struggle, the Hart can provide crucial assistance for the final confrontation with the corruption's source.
dcChecks: Animal Handling DC 15: Approach the Withered Hart without alarming it
Religion DC 14: Understand the sacred nature of this place and the Hart's role as guardian
Insight DC 13: Recognize the Hart's pain and the burden it carries as the forest's last defender
locations.accessibility: Sacred hollow accessible through narrow stone passages, hidden from casual discovery

features.name: Ancient Petroglyphs
features.description: Stone walls covered in ancient carvings depicting the history of the forest guardians and the cycles of nature.

features.name: Sacred Spring Pools
features.description: Crystal-clear pools of pure water that remain uncorrupted, reflecting starlight and providing sanctuary from the taint.

features.name: Guardian's Altar
features.description: A natural stone formation where forest guardians once received blessings, now serving as the Hart's final refuge.

features.name: Pillar of Fading Light
features.description: A column of pure white light emanating from the Hart's presence, the last beacon of hope in the corrupted woods.

features.name: Hidden Path of the Guardian
features.description: Following the stone map's ancient markings, a concealed trail leads directly through the corruption to the Nexus. This sacred path, known only to the forest guardians, bypasses the normal routes and provides safe passage to NC05 when the map is held.

locations.name: Doomed Explorer's Camp
locations.description: The remains of a hastily abandoned campsite tell a grim story of corruption's advance. Torn tents flutter like funeral shrouds while a cold fire pit contains ashes that still whisper with unnatural voices. Personal belongings lie scattered as if their owners fled in terror, and the very ground beneath the camp pulses with a sickly corruption that spreads further each day.

npcs.name: Corrupted Ranger Thane
npcs.description: Once a proud ranger sent to investigate the corruption, Thane has been partially consumed by the taint but retains enough of his humanity to feel the horror of his transformation. His armor bears the marks of desperate battles against creatures that were once his woodland allies, and his eyes flicker between awareness and malevolent hunger.
npcs.attitude: Tortured and conflicted, desperately fighting against the corruption within him. May beg for death or warn the party before succumbing to violent episodes.

lootTable: Ranger's journal detailing the corruption's rapid spread
Partially corrupted healing potions (risky to use)
Map marking the epicenter of the corruption
plotHooks: Thane's journal reveals the corruption's accelerating timeline and growing intelligence
The ranger was sent by a distant outpost, indicating the threat's wider recognition
Thane's transformation shows how the corruption affects those who linger too long
Evidence suggests the corruption is being deliberately spread rather than occurring naturally
locations.dmInstructions: Thane represents the tragic human cost of the corruption. His internal struggle should evoke sympathy while demonstrating the immediate danger. If the party can reach his uncorrupted side, he can provide crucial intelligence before either dying peacefully or asking them to end his suffering. This encounter should emphasize the urgency of stopping the corruption's spread.

traps.name: Corrupted Campfire
traps.description: The cold ashes burst into unnatural flames when disturbed, spreading corrupting energy.
traps.effect: 2d4 necrotic damage in 10-foot radius, DC 14 Wisdom save or be frightened for 1 minute

dcChecks: Medicine DC 14: Understand the nature of Thane's corruption and potential treatments
Investigation DC 12: Piece together the timeline of the camp's abandonment from scattered evidence
Insight DC 15: Recognize when Thane is lucid versus when the corruption is controlling him
locations.accessibility: Abandoned campsite in a small clearing, easily spotted but emanating obvious danger

features.name: Abandoned Equipment
features.description: Ranger gear and personal belongings scattered in haste, some items partially dissolved by corruption.

features.name: Whisper Ashes
features.description: The campfire's cold ashes whisper fragments of Thane's memories and the horrors he witnessed.

features.name: Corruption Pools
features.description: Small pools of dark liquid corruption seeping from the ground, growing larger with each passing hour.

features.name: Torn Research Notes
features.description: Scattered pages from Thane's investigation into the corruption, partially legible but deeply disturbing.

locations.name: The Corrupted Nexus
locations.description: Atop this windswept hill stand the crumbling ruins where Malarok the Corruptor has established his dark sanctuary. At the center of the ancient stone circle, a massive Voidstone Shard pulses with corrupted starlight, amplifying the sorcerer's power. The very air around the altar shimmers with dark magic, and the ground radiates outward with veins of corruption. Ancient trees have become twisted by Malarok's rituals, their forms warped by the Voidstone's influence.

npcs.name: Malarok the Corruptor
npcs.description: A powerful human sorcerer consumed by his lust for power, Malarok has bound himself to the Voidstone Shard to amplify his dark magic. Clad in robes that seem to absorb light, he conducts terrible rituals to corrupt the land and bend it to his will. His eyes burn with the same dark energy as the Voidstone, and his voice carries the authority of one who has tasted ultimate power.
npcs.attitude: Arrogant and megalomaniacal, convinced of his superiority. He will monologue about his plans for power and mock the party before engaging in deadly combat to protect his Voidstone.

monsters: 1 Malarok the Corruptor (CR 3, human sorcerer with Voidstone enhancement)
2 Elite Bandit Bodyguards (CR 1 each, bandits enhanced by Malarok's magic)
1-2 Corrupted Wolves (CR 1/2 each, wolves twisted by the sorcerer's power)
lootTable: Fragment of the Voidstone Shard (dangerous but valuable to scholars)
Alien technology partially corrupted by the void energy
Crystal containing trapped souls of corruption victims
Ancient ritual components for purification magic
plotHooks: The Voidstone Shard is the source of all corruption in the region and must be destroyed
Malarok seeks to use the Voidstone's power to control the entire frontier
Destroying the Voidstone will begin healing the entire northern forest
Malarok deliberately sought out and bound himself to the fallen star fragment
locations.dmInstructions: This is the climactic boss fight of the module. Malarok should be challenging but not impossible for a level 2 party, especially if they've gained allies and information from previous encounters. The fight should emphasize the sorcerer's arrogance and power while providing clear victory conditions. Success here should feel like a significant triumph that saves the entire region.

traps.name: Void Energy Discharge
traps.description: The meteorite periodically releases waves of corrupting energy that affect the entire hilltop.
traps.effect: 3d6 necrotic damage to all creatures within 60 feet, DC 15 Constitution save for half damage

traps.name: Reality Distortion Field
traps.description: The alien presence warps reality around the meteorite, creating dangerous spatial anomalies.
traps.effect: Teleports creature to random location within 30 feet, DC 14 Wisdom save to resist

dcChecks: Arcana DC 18: Understand the nature of the Voidstone corruption and potential methods to destroy it
Religion DC 16: Invoke divine power to weaken Malarok's dark magic
Investigation DC 14: Find weak points in the Voidstone's crystalline structure
locations.accessibility: Hilltop accessible from the grove below, but approach is hindered by reality distortions and void energy

features.name: Voidstone Altar
features.description: A massive shard of fallen star bound to an ancient stone altar, pulsing with dark energy that amplifies Malarok's sorcerous power.

features.name: Corruption Channels
features.description: Veins of dark crystal spreading outward from the Voidstone, carved by Malarok's rituals to channel corrupting energy across the land.

features.name: Twisted Sentinel Trees
features.description: Ancient trees transformed by Malarok's magic into spires of corrupted wood, their forms warped to serve as guardians of his ritual site.

features.name: Magic Distortion Fields
features.description: Visible distortions in the air around the Voidstone where Malarok's powerful magic has warped the natural flow of energy.

The battle erupts under a stormy sky charged with unstable void energy. The corrupted wolves strike first, with Kira and Thane exchanging arrows and attacks to harry the foes. Eirik conjures a Spiritual Weapon that, combined with crossbow shots, wounds Malarok severely despite his Mirror Image defenses. Thane's precise shots finally bring down Malarok, unraveling the corruption's hold and shaking the enemy's resolve. Eiriks divine magic and martial prowess cut through the remaining enemies, with the Spiritual Weapon smashing one bandit, and crossbow fire thinning the ranks of wolves. Scout Kira and Thane provide crucial ranged support, delivering final shots that fell the last corrupted wolf and bodyguard. The fierce storm breaks as the last enemies fall, leaving the hilltop silent, the Voidstone altar cold and still.
